text:
—It was 6.5 million years ago.
It is said that we descended from 'Venus', which nestles close to the 'Sun'.

Transformed from 'Great Souls', into 'Spiritual Leaders'.
We are the ones leading people repeating the cycle of reincarnation toward liberation—
Towards the next state of existence.

Unbound by the vessel that is the physical body.
Therefore, we are eternal youths who never age.

That was the natural 'conclusion' one would reach by pushing
the ideology of 'Reincarnation is Supreme' to its limit.

Far from dying of old age, we don't even become adults.
We continue to repeat the 'present' eternally.

But, it seems there was an inherent strain, after all.
Naturally so, for there is no such thing as a perfect 'world' anywhere.

Of the 104 of us who were there at first, our numbers dwindled,
one by one, two by two, until I realized we could be counted on one hand.

I believe they likely chose to vanish of their own accord.
...For the concepts of aging, sickness, injury, and death do not exist for us.

Having been involved in the establishment of the otherworldly Shangri-La,
the counterpart to the otherworldly Devaloka, I am aware myself.

In the 'App', I am identified as a 'Demon'.
That is, because I am 'an existence that has entered the demonic realm'.

And, while entering the demonic realm = achieving enlightenment, that is not difficult.
The difficult thing would be to 'return after having achieved enlightenment'.

To vanish from this world is not difficult.
What is difficult is 'returning after having vanished'.

Do you understand, my juniors? Until you understand that,
you all... will never surpass the place where I stand.

Indeed, as one of those who remained—
I wanted to show the way to the people.

As a form of 'the end of the world', as an illusion of youth,
I thought I would become an ally to humanity living
in the present, and an enemy to their future.
I acknowledged that this was the role of my existence.

Staying in this city as a student all this time,
alongside a collaborator who provides 'spiritual guidance'.

And so, I am here in this 'Tokyo'.
To witness the evolution of humanity, across vast stretches of time and worlds.

On the stage, players in happi coats are beating drums rhythmically.
Small drums are lined up in the back row, and in the center is a player of the great drum.

The great drum player is a large man, his red loincloth standing out against his black happi.
He is the well-known General Manager of Umamichi Academy.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
—Hah!
Haaah—, hai! Yah!

name: Ogre
text:
Hah! Hai!
Yoisho!!

Energetic low tones resonate.
Following behind, the small drum players release their shouts.

The stage is filled with the pulse of festival music and drums,
and the performance increases in heat along with the intensifying beat.

options.text: The General Manager is so cool...
I knew he'd be good at something like this.
(Get lost in the performance)

text:
The float parade had ended, and the next performance had begun.
A Taiko drum dance by the members of Umamichi Academy.

Sweat scatters with every strike, and white breath dissipates into the air.
Steam rises from his skin like an aura.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
So—re!
Yoisho!

The dance raises the voltage,
and Sanat Kumara's movements become larger and more forceful.

Every time those muscular arms are swung upward, both the happi and the sash loosen,
and his sweat-slicked skin glows vulnerably under the lights.

options.text: ...I'm starting to get a little worried.
This is way too bad for my heart!!
My expectation, and worry are...!

text:
Then, a particularly strong wind blew.
And then—

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
Haah! Hah...?
Uoh...!?

options.text: T-They're too 'bountiful'...!?
I-I have to go cover him up...!
(Hurriedly look away)

text:
The loosened sash unravels, exposing his muscular body.
Several trails of sweat flow down his firm yet abundant chest.

What on earth will he do—
Concerned, slightly excited gazes are directed from the audience.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
Eei, get out of the way—! There!
Haah—! Hah!

Voices of awe rise from the audience.
Sanat Kumara threw off the happi that was caught on his shoulder.

And so, clad only in a loincloth and tabi socks,
he finished the dance while steam rose from his shoulders.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
Be careful, don't push each other as you receive them!
There's plenty for everyone, so don't forget to share.

[Player] watches the top of the tower from a slight distance
from the crowd gathered for the mochi-throwing event.

options.text: It's a good thing nothing happened earlier... maybe?
Maybe I'll go when it clears up a bit more...
There are a lot of little kids, I'll stay quiet.

text:
Sanat Kumara was atop the tower with several organizers,
scattering individually wrapped mochi to the gathered people.

Red and white sets of mochi are scattered,
and children scramble to pick them up.

Sanat Kumara had changed from his festival outfit into a Santa outfit.
A school uniform-style jacket and a long scarf flutter in the wind.

From atop the tower, through his distressed hat,
his sharp eyes are directed toward [Player], and his mouth moves wildly.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
(Hey, you sure you aren't coming?
We'll run out of mochi soon?)

options.text: (Wave back vigorously)

dialogue_after_selection.text: Sanat Kumara waves back sheepishly to [Player], who is standing a little apart from the circle.

options.text: (Stick out your tongue)
(Blow a kiss)

dialogue_after_selection.text:
Sanat Kumara dropped the mochi he was holding.
The bag of mochi falls to the base of the tower.

text:
Sanat Kumara picks up a new mochi and
points at [Player] with a thick finger.

Then he winds up—
And the mochi is thrown with the speed of a fastball.

[Player] hurriedly held out both hands and
managed to catch it just in time.

When [Player] looked back toward Sanat Kumara,
he had raised a fist in approval of the impressive catch.

With a satisfied smile, Sanat Kumara
began distributing mochi to the children again.

The mochi-throwing ended, and with this, the winter festival truly came to an end—
Such a mood filled the approach to the shrine.

A short distance from the approach crowded with people heading home.
Sanat Kumara emerged from the dressing room provided by the organizers.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
Sorry to keep you waiting, [Player].
Sorry, it took more time than expected.

options.text: No, you've worked hard with the mochi-throwing.
Oh, did you take a liking to the Santa outfit?

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text: Because I made you wait while I helped with various things, I thought I should at least get into the Christmas spirit.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Don't tease me too much.
Dressing up so festively on the street is rather unsettling.

options.text: It was cold, so please warm me up.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
War...!?
You, what are you saying out in public!?

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
...Er, well, if you're cold...
I'll buy you some sweet sake.
The stalls should still be open.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
The festival is just about over, but let's walk around together.
...Mmm, here.

While clearing his throat, Sanat Kumara clumsily
proffered his rugged palm.

options.text: (Hold his hand obediently)

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Hmm! Let's go!
Tell me if my grip is too strong.
...I have no experience with this, you see.
Sanat Kumara's hand, as hard and heavy as a rock, envelopes [Player]'s hand with the delicacy of touching something fragile.

options.text: (Interlock arms and snuggle up)

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Uooh!? N-No, it's nothing!
L-Let's go...!
With his back stiff and looking visibly nervous, Sanat Kumara begins to walk.

options.text: Please tell me what you want to do properly~

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Ugh... You have a point...
But to say something so cheesy...!

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
...Fine, I'll say it!
Er, um, well, won't you... hold my hand?
In a faltering, embarrassed tone, Sanat Kumara grasped [Player]'s hand.

text:
After walking a few steps, Sanat Kumara suddenly
stops at the side of the road.

options.text: General Manager, what's wrong?
(Look forward to his next outburst)
(Bump into his back and look up)

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
[Player]!!
Listen well!!

Beside the crowd, Sanat Kumara bellows in a 'loud voice'.
It's not a tone of anger, but something more like a solemn vow.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
I am a traditional 'man', and I am completely useless at 'affairs of the heart'.
But— For now, I shall face you with all my might!!

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
I, the General Manager of Umamichi, shall escort you with everything I have!
You too— Come at me with everything you've got!!

options.text: You're way too loud!!
I-I'll follow you, General Manager...!!
Make sure to flirt with me if you do, okay?

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Ugh, a 'Great Devil'-like provocation, rather than a little devilish one...!
When it comes to romance, you are indeed ahead of me...!

text:
Threading through the flow of people heading home, the two hurry around the stalls.
There's only so much time before the festival ends.

Standard menu items like takoyaki and yakisoba, along with
winter festival staples like sweet sake and non-alcoholic mulled wine.

Menu items from the worlds of Devaloka and Shangri-La,
such as Jalebi or Gulab Jamun.

Jalebi: common Indian sweet snack, made by frying flour batter in pretzel/circular shapes
may or may not be related to churros
Gulab Jamun: also a common Indian sweet snack, made by frying milk solids to the shape of balls

But no matter how hard they tried, it didn't take long
until the stalls began to close.

Just as they were about to join the flow of people heading home,
Sanat Kumara, the General Manager, pulled [Player]'s hand.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
It's yet too early to return home.
It's a festival, so isn't there 'something else to do'?

At the festival grounds, where the stalls have closed and most guests have left.
In a corner of the plaza, where the decorating floats are to be collected later.

Under the lonely illumination of the lights,
the two remained in that deserted area.

options.text: I'll fix this side down.
So the 'thing to do' was cleaning up.
(I was hoping for something more...)

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
...That should be the last of them.
Even if it's just covering them with sheets and securing them, they are still delicate work.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
After all, such magnificent craftsmanship went into these.
If they were to break here, the participants would be saddened.

Sitting side-by-side on a nearby bench,
Sanat Kumara looks up at the floats.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
There were festivals like this in Devaloka too.
Though, the construction of the floats, and the festivals' meaning were different.

options.text: They had festivals like this over there too.
It's rare for you to talk about memories.
I want to hear your old stories, General Manager!

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
What, it's not that big of a deal. Only that...
I thought it might be an ironic festival for those young rascals.

options.text: What do you mean by 'ironic'?
It doesn't sound like you mean it in a bad way.
Oh, so the float-pulling festival over there is...

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
Mmm. The float parade in Devaloka, one of my homeworlds,
was a celebration for the return of the 'Black Incarnation' to home.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
He had a home that welcomed him back with blessings.
But that is not necessarily the case for them.

While still looking up at the floats, Sanat Kumara speaks quietly.
White breath escapes his lips, and mixes with the mountain air.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
Will those who pulled the floats today be able to leave
their temporary dwelling and find a place that accepts them?

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
Will they be able to extend their hands once more, after having been rejected?
Will they be able to... connect with someone again?

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
This incident is not the end of a grand finale, but the start of a long and difficult training.
And most will stay there, 'mistaking the demonic realm for enlightenment'.

name: Sanat Kumara
text: That... makes me worried beyond belief.

options.text: They did it today, so they can do it next time too.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
.......
'The power to gain connections with others', I see.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
That is indeed something I have no need for.
Not for me, who holds this 'Sacred Artifact' of ethereal light.
At his words, Sanat Kumara's hand emanates a black ethereal glow.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
This is the same as Jagannath's 'Krishna'.
The power used to become one with another.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text: With this power in his hands, he gained the status of 'Ambidextrous', just like his ally.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Most people would mistake the cause for the effect...
But the 'demon' is the 'power to become one', after all.
At his words, Sanat Kumara recalls his other self, Kiichi Hogen.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Hogen...
I don’t intend to follow that old man's lead, but choosing to watch over people like him is a path you might take.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
But it wouldn't be so bad to infiltrate the Police Academy and gain that kind of experience.
After all, I do have the power to infiltrate at my command.

options.text: You're looking down on those kids too much.
Don't think of them as children forever.

text:
Sanat Kumara then gives a big stretch, laughs self-deprecatingly, and...
For some reason, breaks into a bright smile.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
...You're right. Those children will grow in their own ways.
Having a third party worried about them is probably what they'd hate most.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
I tend to view things from above, as a protector.
That's why your way of life, sometimes looks incredibly dazzling.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
...What I'm saying is that I find talking to you pleasant.
Though sometimes, your freedom tends to go a bit too far?

Sanat Kumara stands up straight.
Perhaps due to the heavy lifting, sweat flows down his neck and chest.

options.text: You've worked up a sweat.
Just the cleaning was quite exhausting...
(Shiver as your body cools down)

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
Actually, the owner of the hot springs has kept it
open as a token of gratitude for our help.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
If you'd like, why don't we wash off the sweat together?
While we warm up... I'd like to talk to you a bit more.

options.text: I'll wash your back! And anything else besides your back!

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
T-That's exactly what I meant!
I'm saying your freedom goes way too far!!!

options.text: If you're going to invite, please be more passionate!

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
T-That's exactly what I meant!
I'm saying your freedom goes way too far!!!

options.text: We still have time before curfew.

text:
The hot spring, which the owner graciously kept open,
was deserted and in a private state.

A few seconds after [Player] entered the bathhouse,
Sanat Kumara followed.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
Hmph, it's quite authentic...
Though an Otherworld with a human touch is quite a strange thing.

options.text: (Look away)

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Hm? Was it a bit too stimulating?
But forgive me, this is a hot spring, after all...!

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Besides, I have no shame in this body!
Though I may have no shame...
Modesty is also a necessary thing.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
I shall try not to show off too much.
Exposing ourselves to each other should always be fair.

options.text: (Emphasize your own body in return)

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
So you're challenging me, my junior!?
Your burning physical body, your youth... Bring it all at me!
Taking advantage of being alone, the two strike several poses, pitting their physical bodies against each other.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
...Phew! What a heated moment that was!
Your discipline... was magnificent! You've worked hard!

options.text: Yaaaay! A feast for the eyes!!

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Settle down, my junior!
Just because no one is here, it doesn't mean you can say whatever you want!

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
...Well, I don't exactly... dislike it.
But, please choose your time and place!

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
Now, let's head for the tub. ...Or so I'd like to say,
but it seems there's a foot bath corner over there as well.

options.text: (Choose the foot bath)

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Phew... Putting even just your legs in the water feels soothing.
After walking around so much, I suppose I may be tired.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
[Player], you should rest properly as well.
This festival was quite a major undertaking.

options.text: (Sit next to him in the tub)

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Phew... The hot water is indeed soothing.
After walking around so much, I suppose I may be tired.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
[Player], you should rest properly as well.
This festival was quite a major undertaking.

options.text: (Get close to him in the tub)

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Uooh!?
W-Wait, I-I'm not mentally prepared...!

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Fuu... haah...
Fuu... haah...

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
...Fine, come here, [Player]!
I shall accept your 'impulse'...!

text:
As the water warms their bodies, a sudden silence fills the area,
almost as a reaction to the previous excitement.

Neither of them said anything.
Within the silence, only the sound of the wind and water echoed.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
(...T-This is awkward...!
What on earth should I talk about?)

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
(When we're touring stalls or working, there are things to talk about,
but when things settle down like this, I can't think of anything...!)

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
(...I have always watched over, and guided humanity from the heights of heaven.
Therefore, I have rarely been side-by-side with anyone.)

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
(From this close, you are looking right into my eyes.
You are touching my inner self. I find it utterly humiliating!)

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
(Why is exposing my heart so much more shameful than exposing my body?
Yet, right now, I refuse to spend this moment simply running away from your gaze...!)

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
[Player]!!
I-I have a favor to ask of you!

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
This may sound like a strange favor, but...
With those eyes of yours...
Could you look at me from as close as possible...!?

options.text: (Peer into his eyes)

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Guh, the eyes of my junior...!
I must endure this trial to the very end...!!

options.text: Y-You're asking so suddenly...!?

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Guh, the eyes of my junior...!
I must endure this trial to the very end...!!

options.text: (Try to kiss his lips)

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
A-As I thought, I really can't do this!!!
I'm getting out, I'm starting to get dizzy...!!

Wiping off and getting dressed before leaving the bathhouse,
they find Sanat Kumara standing, looking awkwardly.

The area feels completely like the aftermath of a festival.
Not a soul in sight, leaving a faint darkness to spread.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
Earlier... I'm sorry for showing you such a pathetic side.
It seems that I... still have more training as a Mahatma to do.

options.text: Your 'fleeing from the enemy' character's quite cute as well.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Guh...! You just had to always do such a thing...!
Yet... I am in no position to say anything...!

options.text: No, I got a bit carried away too.
I'd accompany you for any kind of 'night training'...

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Guh...! You just had to always do such a thing...!
Yet... I am in no position to say anything...!

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
As an apology... I'll escort you back to the Kiou dorms.
The Police Academy seems strict about curfews.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
My conscience would ache if you were scolded for playing with me.
Here, hold on tight.

options.text: (Get on his back)
(Get held in his arms)
(Get carried like a princess)

text:
The sound of wings beating fills the air, as weight presses down on [Player]'s body.
It wasn't the feeling that gravity has vanished, but the force of flight that defies it.

A few seconds of intense upward acceleration follow,
before coming to a sudden, smooth halt.

Opening their eyes, they find themselves high above.
Carried by Sanat Kumara's wings, they are at a height unattainable in daily life.

Looking down, mountains and clusters of lights are visible.
And, the night sky stretches out, much closer to them than usual.

Ethereal wings, looking as if they're sprinkled
with starlight, spread out and flapped gently.

options.text: (Be excited by the height)

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Huh...
You have qualities befitting a junior.
Well then, let's play around a bit.

The wings flap, and Sanat Kumara leaps lightly.
He then flies along the outline of the mountains.
Sanat Kumara soars, swimming over the mountain ridges, passing them by at high speed.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Invigorating, isn't it, [Player]!?
Ah, I have also longed to reach this state with someone.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text: I was alone in these heights of heaven, so just having you here makes this night so much more vivid!

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Once you're satisfied, let's take a short break.
No matter how fearless you are, flying would still be a burden.

options.text: (Hold on so as not to fall)

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Fufu...
No, sorry, I didn't mean to mock you.
I was just happy to know that you also have things you're afraid of, you see.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
My body won't be hurt by someone with your level of strength.
Don't be shy, just hold on tight.

The wings flap slowly.
At a calm pace like walking, the two cross the night sky.
A time so calm that the winter cold and chilly wind feel like gentle things, if only for just a moment.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
We'll descend once we're at a suitable place.
One who is unaccustomed cannot adapt to the height of the sky so easily.

options.text: (Secretly touch his body)

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Uoohhhhhhh!?
Hey!! At any time other than this...!?

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
You fool!!
Flying is different from being on the ground!!
What do you intend to do if we lose our balance!?
And it's not that we will!?

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
Gaaahhhh!!
There's a limit to how free you can be!!
Don't rub my chest! Don't stroke my belly! Don't lick my neck—!!
Swaying here and there with unsteady flapping, the two zigzag through the sky.

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
'Impulse' is also a part of youth...!
But you, pick your timing better!!

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
No, there isn't supposed to be a moment for this!?
We are still in the position of students!!
...Alright, we're descending now.

text:
A corner of the mountain that has become part of the Otherworld.
Tucking his wings away, he lands at a point like a slightly open plateau.

Sanat Kumara kneels down with
concern and strokes [Player]'s ear.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
Phew... I got a bit too carried away.
Are you nauseous, or hurt anywhere?

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
I've heard the deep insides of the ear can hurt due to air pressure.
That's not happening, right? ...Then all is well.

In a complete turnaround from the time at
the hot springs, their gazes meet directly.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
You're a strange one, and yet your presence is comforting.
You reached into my inner self without hesitation,
and yet your touch felt incredibly gentle.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
Perhaps that's why I'm feeling very strange right now.
I wanted to reach out to your heart... and you to mine.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
...Hey, [Player]—
What did you gain from this festival?
Did you achieve what people call 'growth'?

options.text: ...Maybe, a little.
I'm not really sure.
What about you?

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
What you have gained and how you have grown.
That's something you can only know by looking back after your youth has ended.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
Even if you did know, it would be difficult to put into precise words.
I... also cannot yet put into precise words what I gained from this festival.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
Only once you leave here and look back from the outside,
only then... can you truly see its outline.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
And someday, you gain the ability to 'return'.
When you'd be able to 'choose where to be'.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
Are my feelings reaching you?
...Still, I don't feel like I've gotten them to you just yet.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
...I want to understand you more.
Far deeper than exchanging words, or touching each other...

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
6.5 million years ago, when I descended to 'that land'...
I haven't taken a single step forward since then.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
Eternal youth. Life forever in bloom.
It's true nature is stagnation... 'rather than freedom'.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
In the end, I am 'imprisoned by agelessness'.
Do know that to surpass me, is to find an answer beyond that.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
I am a wall that watches over humanity, to eventually be surpassed.
And those who have finished their rite of passage surpass me and move forward.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
And so, I— continue to 'stagnate' there.
A wall meant to be climbed is destined to stand alone,
once everyone has reached the other side.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
I have never once cursed that solitude, though I am proud of it.
For I am a 'Spiritual Leader', and I have a duty and a perspective to uphold.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
...Ah, but still.
At some point along the way, I had a wish for my own—

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
—So this is the power to 'gain connection with others', I suppose.
It irritates me to admit that 'that man' was right, but here we are.

options.text: General Manager, your heart's flowing straight into me...!
It's sparkling, warm, and beautiful.
(Be mesmerized by Sanat Kumara's body)

dialogue_after_selection.name: Sanat Kumara
dialogue_after_selection.text:
I didn't think you can even think of that right now.
You'll definitely become someone formidable...

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
Our 'lives' are now blending to an infinite degree.
Secrets, deceptions, they have no power here.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
...Therefore, my mission, my wish, and my pride.
You must have been able to feel them all.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
The same goes for the Umamichi rascals, and for you.
My feelings that I cannot put into words— You should have felt them.

Sanat Kumara grasped [Player]'s hand
with his ethereal hand.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
To gain a connection means that
a future of rupture will someday appear.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
Still, I want to connect with you more deeply than I do now.
I want to descend from the heights of heaven and walk the earth with you.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
At this festival... For my own sake and no one else's,
I was able to wish for that.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
What about you? Did you gain anything from this festival?
Can you share what you have gained— with me?

options.text: (Close your eyes and wait for a kiss)
(Steal Sanat Kumara's lips)
(Overlap your 'lives' even more deeply)

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
...! Ah... No, I was just surprised.
I never considered that I'd feel this way.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
You've always been so honest, someone so pleasant to be around.
From now onwards, I can watch you from even closer.

Wings like the night sky spread,
and [Player] is enclosed within them.

Within the sweet cage of feathers,
Sanat Kumara's abundant chest envelopes [Player].

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
Having received gifts from both Santa and you...
I am a very lucky person.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
And now, though I'm not Santa,
I have a present that I wish to give you.

name: Sanat Kumara
text:
I, who was supposed to show the way, was shown the way by you.
That is what I wanted to tell you.

Overlapped hearts. A mental landscape where no one else could reach.
There, the two overlap their 'lives', melting their breaths into one another.

Just a little longer until 'curfew' comes.
So that they do not forget this warmth— They step forward, into the beyond.
